message: :D
This condo is amazing. :)
Not yet. I'm open for anything that isn't moving.
Not moving under its own fuel*
it would be nice to be able to stay nearby for the after party
Yeah, I'm over on Mass Avenue. Airbnb ftw.
is there anything going on for dinner?
not moving... like not from a truck?
If someone local brings over a Weber I'll cook :)
@johnbellone I thought I saw a grill out front this morning
@leah Yeah, was here yesterday and some dude was grilling. We can go grab a crap-ton of groceries and have a cook out.
@leah That'd be it.
Apparently the best pizza in Indiana is around the corner(*) So I was told.
bazbeaux? http://www.yelp.com/biz/bazbeaux-pizza-indianapolis
the speakers went there last night for the speaker dinner... it was really good!

Yat's on Mass is pretty darn good if you like cajun over rice type stuff (also vegetarian dishes), Old Point Tavern on Mass has the most ridiculous vegetarian nachos (also decent scotch selection last I was there), Chatham Tap is a tasty pub and has a decent beer selection. I've heard great things about Black Market and Ball and Biscuit (next to Bazbeaux) lately.
@bnferguson The place I am staying it is right near Yats. It is like $7 for food there, right? There's also a lot of booze :)
I really dig that area of Mass Avenue a lot. The buildings are awesome. Hard wood floors, brick, I'm slowly falling in love with Indy.
@bnferguson Well screw those people. That food sounds awesome.

@johnbellone Mass Ave is sweet, we also have some more edge areas that are very cool. If you can make it down to Fountain Square there's some good stuff down there (much much smaller but I adore the vibe - also the chilled mead and cider at New Day is great, lovely owners too). Also hit up Flat 12 on Dorman if you can. More good vibes, great beer and some grilled pizza too.
@johnbellone Yeah $7 gets you a mound of a couple things on the menu. I love the place, variable menu, spicy, good stuff. Some people aren't so fond.
I'm here until Sunday afternoon. I'll ask you for some pointers today.
Nice! More than happy to. :)
I'll cook food if someone goes and picks it up. Need some spices, barbecue sauce, and meat. Sorry for those of you that are vegan-ish.
BARcelona is a local fave for Tapas for me, use Yelp to find the address
I dont know how close YATs is, but as a local I do recommend it. Just awesome food. 659 Massachusetts Avenue, Indianapolis, IN
http://goo.gl/WyE0v
@johnbellone I have a weber near by if you need another ;)
Chatham Tap on Mass Ave is great - super crowded on Fridays, though. Probably 30 restaurants on that street, though.
@Electrasteph Looked like it would be crowded.
Old Pointe (mentioned above) is a great alternative to Chatham Tap. MacNivens is good too.
if you are looking for something nicer, checkout rbistro http://www.rbistro.com/
Not yet it seems. YATs is really good I hear.
If anyone has a car it'd be greatly appreciated for a ride wherever we decide to go. :D

I need more meat than what Yatz has to offer, but those who have not been there and are craving cajun, it's an Indiana must.
I have to drive back to Noblesville to check the Malamute, but am hoping to come back for the party afterwards. I will probably grab dinner in the Hamilton County area if anyone would like to join.
